subsectionContent.task: Kiedy używamy zwrotów I wish/If only? Jaka jest między nimi różnica? Jak wygląda ich użycie w zdaniu (konstrukcja)?
Przekształć każde zdanie tak, żeby to drugie zdanie znaczyło to samo co pierwsze. Każde zdanie zacznij od zwrotu I wish/If only.
content: You're so stubborn.
My mother doesn't cook well.
I'm not a woman.
London is so far away.
They didn't accept my invitation.
I didn't get that job.
I locked myself out.
Please leave!
I hate it when you ignore me.
I hate it when she doesn't text me back.
answers: I wish/If only you weren't so stubborn.
I wish/If only my mother cooked well.
I wish/If only I were a woman.
I wish/If only London wasn't so far away.
I wish/If only they had accepted my invitation.
I wish/If only I had got that job.
I wish/If only I hadn't locked myself out.
I wish/If only you would leave.
I wish/If only you wouldn't ignore me. ('didn't ignore' is also possible; depends on the context)
I wish/If only she would text me back. ('texted' is also possible; depends on the context)

subsectionContent.task: Przetłumacz polskie fragmenty zdań na język angielski.
content: If only ... (nie kupiła) this car. It's giving me lots of trouble.
Pam wishes the teachers ... (nie zadawali) her so much homework.
If only I ... (mógł studiować) in London. I would have so many cool experiences!
Do you sometimes wish ... (żeby być) a completely different person?
Peter wishes he ... (urodził się) very rich. He wouldn't have to look for a job.

subsectionContent.task: Przetłumacz polskie fragmenty zdań na język angielski.
content: If only you ... (tell) me about your problems earlier!
I really wish my boyfriend ... (not spend) so much time watching sports on TV! It's driving me mad!
Do you sometimes wish you ... (be) a different person?
The party was a disaster and now I wish I ... (not go) there at all.
If only I  ... (have) more spare time for my hobbies!
Tom says he feels lonely in London and that he sometimes wishes he ... (never / leave) his hometown.

subsectionContent.task: Przetłumacz poniższe zdania.
content: Chciałabym mieć więcej przyjaciół.
Chciałabym, żebyś tu był.
Chciałabym znaleźć sztabkę złota.
Żałuję, że cię obraziłem.
Sanda chciałaby być lepszą nauczycielką.
Żałuję, że wrzuciłem to zdjęcie na Instagrama.
answers: I wish I had more friends.
I wish I could find a gold bar.
I wish I hadn't offended you.
Sanda wishes she were a better teacher.
I wish I hadn't posted that picture on Instagram.

subsectionContent.task: Kiedy używamy zwrotów would rather/would prefer? Jaka jest między nimi różnica? Jak wygląda ich użycie w zdaniu (konstrukcja)?
Przetłumacz fragmenty zdań w nawiasach. Możesz używać I'd rather lub I'd prefer, jak Ci wygodnie, ale najlepiej, żeby było tu trochę i tego, i tego.
content: _____ (Wolę pocałować) a frog than go bungee-jumping.
_____ (Wolisz kupić mi) a diamond or a new ring?
_____ (Wolałbym zostać) at home yesterday. The party was really boring.
_____ (Wolę, żebyś zapomniał) everything you have seen here today.
_____ (Woleliby nie przyjeżdżać) here because they have been bored all week.
_____ (Wolę, żebyś nie mówił) anything about it. It's a secret.
answers: I'd rather kiss (jedynie ta odpowiedź jest poprawna ponieważ w zdaniu występuje 'than')
Would you rather buy me / Would you prefer to buy me
I'd rather have stayed / I'd prefer to have stayed
I'd rather you forgot / I'd prefer you to forget
They'd rather not have come / They'd prefer not to have come
I'd rather you didn't say / I'd prefer you not to say

subsectionContent.task: Wybierz jedną z dwóch rzeczy, które wolałbyś zrobić lub której wolałbyś nie robić. Napisz po dwa zdania - jedno z I'd rather, a drugie z I'd prefer.
content: eat a mouse / drink monkey blood
die in a car crash / die in my sleep
marry someone beautiful but stupid / marry someone ugly but intelligent
be rich and have no friends / be poor and have many friends
answers:
I'd rather eat a mouse than drink monkey blood.
I'd prefer ti eat a mouse rather than drink monkey blood.

I'd rather die in my sleep than die in a car crash.
I'd prefer to die in my sleep rather than die in a car crash.

I'd rather marry someone beautiful but stupid than marry someone ugly but intelligent.
I'd prefer to marry someone beautiful but stupid rather than marry someone ugly but intelligent.

I'd rather be poor and have many friends than be rich and have no friends.
I'd prefer to be poor and have many friends rather than be rich and have no friends.

subsectionContent.task: Przetłumacz poniższe zdania, korzystając z wyrazów w nawiasach.
content: Wolałabym pójść do kina niż do teatru. (rather)
Wolelibyśmy jechać na wycieczkę, niż pracować. (rather)
Wolałabym być teraz sama. (prefer)
Walałbym, żebyś więcej do mnie nie dzownił. (prefer)
Kiedy byłam mała wolałam jeść słodycze niż warzywa. (rather)
Wolałbym, żebyś do mnie nie dzwonił. (rather)
answers: I would rather go to the cinema than to the theatre.
We would rather go on a trip than work.
I would prefer to be alone now.
I would prefer you not to call me anymore.
When I was little, I would rather have eaten sweets than vegetables.
I would rather you didn't call me.

subsectionContent.task: Kiedy używamy konstrukcji It's (high) time? Jak wygląda jej użycie w zdaniu (konstrukcja)?
Przetłumacz poniższe zdania.
content: Czas iść spać.
Najwyższy czas, żebyśmy poszli do lekarza.
Pora, żebyś zaczął uprawiać sport.
Najwyższy czas, żebyśmy mieli dziecko.
Czas, żeby ludzie zaczęli dbać o środowisko.
Najwyższy czas, żebyś zaczął uczyć się angielskiego.
answers: It's time to go/we went to bed.
It's high time we went to the doctor.
It's time for you to start/you started doing sports.
It's high time we had a child.
It's time for people to start/people started taking care of the environment.
It's high time you started learning English.

subsectionContent.source: Grama to nie drama 2; ex. ex. 68.2/100-101
subsectionContent.task: Kolega opowiada Ci o swoich problemach. Poradź mu, jak może sobie z nimi poradzić. Co czas zrobić?
content: My car is really dirty.
I don't have a girlfriend.
I'm always late for work.
This kettle won't work.
I don't like my job.
answers: It's time to clean your car.
It's high time you got a girlfriend.
It's time you started being on time for work.
It's high time you bought a new kettle.
It's time you found a new job.

subsectionContent.heading: Should and had better and must - comparison

subsectionContent.task: Kiedy używamy zwrotu had better? Jak wygląda jego użycie w zdaniu (konstrukcja)?
Dopisz radę do każdej z poniższych sytuacji stosując had better. Radę wybierz z poniższej listy: ask first, not go there, take an umbrella, tell the truth, go to the dentist.
content: It's going to rain. ________________
I have a toothache. ________________
I want to take my dad's car. ________________
I lied to my parents. ________________
This place looks dangerous. ________________
answers: You had better take an umbrella.
You had better go to the dentist.
You had better tell the truth.
You had better not go there.

subsectionContent.task: Wyobraź sobie, że za miesiąc bierzesz ślub. Organizacja ślubu i wesela to duże wyzwania i sporo może pojść nie tak. Przygotuj 5 zdań o tym, co masz nadzieję, że się wydarzy i nie wydarzy tego dnia, używając had better.
content: Example: There had better be enough alcohol for Uncle Kazik.
answers:
Example sentences:
There had better be a good meal.
A photographer had better have a good camera.
There had better be a good weather.
There had better be a good atmosphere.
A band had better play good music.

subsectionContent.task: Wybierz poprawne uzupełnienie zdania.
content: I (wish / would rather) my dad would spend more time at home.
I (would / had) sooner you stayd at home and helped me clean.
(It's time / If only) Mark had done all his assignments this semester.
It's (as if / time) Mary pursued an advanced degree if she wants to be a teacher.
(If only / I'd rather) I had attended a vocational school. I'd be a trained mechanic by now.
Look at all these people. It's (As though / about time) we were back at school again. Nobody has changed a bit!

subsectionContent.task: Które formy czasowników poprawnie uzupełniają zdania?
content: We’re having a great time in Bournemouth. I wish you ... (are / were / had been) here.
It’s high time you ... (had learnt / will learn / learnt) Italian. You need to communicate with Paolo.
I wish you ... (hadn’t done / wouldn’t do / don’t do) it. It’s so annoying!
Matthew wishes he ... (has / had / had had) a boat. He belongs to Sea Scouts and loves sailing.
You’d better ... (get down / get down / got down) to work before the boss returns.
If only I ... (knew / would know / had known) then what I know now.
I’d sooner we ... (went / had gone / go) to the cinema with them last week. The film is not on any more.
I wish he ... (had stopped / would stop / stopped) blowing his nose so loudly. I can’t concentrate on the programme.

subsectionContent.task: Uzupełnij zdania właściwą formą czasowników podanych w nawiasach.
content: If only I ... (not forget) to study physics last night! I'm afraid I did horribly on the quiz.
It's high time you ... (start) taking your lessons seriously or you'll never get into a good university.
I would rather you ... (help) me with my homework after I've tried it myself. I want to see what I know.
Supposing you ... (begin) studying French sooner, you'd speak it even better now!
I wish you ... (enter) the science competition. I'm sure you would have won a prize.
Imagine you ... (can see) what the future ... (hold).
My parents would sooner I ... (pursue) my own interests instead of trying to fulfil their ambitions.
Tim acts as if he ... (be) a famous scientist rather than a clever 14-year-old.

subsectionContent.task: Uzupełnij drugie zdanie tak, aby znaczyło to samo, co pierwsze, używając podanego słowa.
content:
What a shame she couldn't see our performance! ABLE
I wish she ... see our performance.

It is rather impolite of you to ask him such personal questions. ASK
I'd ... him such personal questions!

I should have followed my father's advice. ONLY
If ... my father's advice.

You definitely need to start taking regular exercise. TIME
It's ... regular exercise.

I really regret buying such an old car! NOT
I wish ... such an old car!

It's a pity I haven't got anything to read on the train. ONLY
... something to read on the train!

subsectionContent.source: Materiał pt. 'Transformacje – Unreal Past' ze strony https://howareyouenglish.pl/
subsectionContent.task: Uzupełnij każde z niedokończonych zdań tak, aby zachować znaczenie zdania wyjściowego. Użyj podanych wyrazów. Nie zmieniaj podanych fragmentów i formy podanych wyrazów. Wymagana jest pełna poprawność ortograficzna wpisywanych fragmentów.
content:
Peter didn’t read the set book. Now he regrets it. (WISHES)
Tom __________ the set book.

I advise you to tidy your room now. (HAD)
You __________ now.

I don’t want you to stay up. (RATHER)
I __________ up.

I don’t want to have sea food for dinner. (WOULD)
I __________ sea food for dinner.

You should tell her the truth. You can’t wait any longer. (HIGH)
It __________ the truth.

My husband plays video games all the time. It’s driving me mad! (WOULD)
I __________ computer games all the time.

I shouted at my child. Now I regret it. (WISH)
I __________ at my child.

He doesn’t want his children to eat fast food. (SOONER)
He __________ fast food.

I advise you not to play truant again. (BETTER)
You __________ again.

Mark regrets not helping his parents in the garden last Saturday. (WISHES)
Mark __________ his parents in the garden last Saturday.
answers: is high time you told/is high time to tell her
would sooner his children didn’t eat

subsectionContent.source: Materiał pt. 'Transformacje – Unreal Past' ze strony https://howareyouenglish.pl/
subsectionContent.task: Uzupełnij każde z niedokończonych zdań tak, aby zachować znaczenie zdania wyjściowego. Użyj podanych wyrazów. Nie zmieniaj podanych fragmentów i formy podanych wyrazów. Wymagana jest pełna poprawność ortograficzna wpisywanych fragmentów.
content:
I bought a sports car and now I regret it. (ONLY)
If __________ a sports car.

It is getting cold. We should turn the heating on. (TIME)
It __________ the heating on.

You borrowed my car without asking. (RATHER)
I __________ without asking.

She is big-headed and overconfident. She thinks she is the boss. (AS)
She behaves __________ the boss.

I didn’t accept their offer. It was a mistake. (ONLY)
If __________ their offer.

She doesn’t want to go by bus. (SOONER)
She __________ by bus.

He didn’t come up with this idea but he thinks he did. (AS)
He __________ with this idea.

We live in the country and we don’t like it. (WISH)
We __________ in the country.

I didn’t buy that dress. It was a mistake. (RATHER)
I __________ that dress.

I went to the party. It was so boring. (RATHER)
I __________ to the party.
answers: is high time we turned/is high time to turn
would rather you hadn’t borrowed my car
acts as if he had come up

subsectionContent.source: Materiał pt. 'Transformacje – Unreal Past' ze strony https://howareyouenglish.pl/
subsectionContent.task: Uzupełnij każde z niedokończonych zdań tak, aby zachować znaczenie zdania wyjściowego. Użyj podanych wyrazów. Nie zmieniaj podanych fragmentów i formy podanych wyrazów. Wymagana jest pełna poprawność ortograficzna wpisywanych fragmentów.
content:
I regret not buying this house. (WISH)
I __________ this house.

I advise you to start revising for the exam. (BETTER)
You __________ for the exam.

I want you and Tom to tidy your room. (RATHER)
I __________ your room.

Kate married Frank and now she regrets it. (WISHES)
Kate __________ Frank.

It’s a pity I don’t know her phone number. (IF)
If __________ her phone number.

I want to watch a comedy tonight. (RATHER)
I __________ a comedy tonight.

He doesn’t own this house but he thinks he does. (AS)
He behaves __________ this house.

I don’t live in London and I regret it. (ONLY)
If __________ in London.

I didn’t learn for the test. Now I regret it. (WISH)
I __________ for the test.

You should start looking for a job. You can’t wait any longer. (HIGH)
It __________ looking for a job.
answers: would rather you and Tom tidied
is high time you started/is high time to start

subsectionContent.source: Materiał pt. 'Transformacje – Unreal Past' ze strony https://howareyouenglish.pl/
subsectionContent.task: Uzupełnij każde z niedokończonych zdań tak, aby zachować znaczenie zdania wyjściowego. Użyj podanych wyrazów. Nie zmieniaj podanych fragmentów i formy podanych wyrazów. Wymagana jest pełna poprawność ortograficzna wpisywanych fragmentów.
content:
You borrow my car without asking. I don’t like it. (SOONER)
I __________ my car without asking.

He doesn’t want his daughter to marry George. (RATHER)
He __________ George.

You always interrupt me. It is so irritating! (WISH)
I __________ me.

I want Tom to repair the washing machine. (RATHER)
I __________ the washing machine.

I moved abroad and I regret it. (WISH)
I __________ abroad.

I don’t want to get promoted. (RATHER)
I __________ promoted.

It’s a pity I don’t meet the requirements for this position. (ONLY)
If __________ the requirements for this position.

I advise you not to tell them about this. (HAD)
You __________ them about this.

I took part in a cycling race. It was a disaster! (WOULD)
I __________ in a cycling race.

I didn’t get to work by bus, but on foot. It was a bad decision. (RATHER)
I __________ by bus than on foot.
answers: would rather his daughter didn’t marry
would rather not have taken part
would rather have got to work

subsectionContent.task: Przekształć zdania, używając podanych początków i zakończeń, tak aby zachować znaczenie zdań wyjściowych. Zapisz odpowiedzi w zeszycie.
content:
Jessica’s manager is angry with her because she often misses deadlines for projects.
Jessica’s manager __________ deadlines for projects.

I regret that I told my parents about our engagement.
If only I __________ about our engagement.

Margaret asks such stupid questions! It’s really irritating!
I wish __________ stupid questions.

You should apologise for your rude behaviour.
You’d __________ rude behaviour.

I’m afraid I don’t know the answer to your question.
I wish __________ to your question.

I’m very disappointed that John missed the penalty in yesterday’s match.
If only John __________ in yesterday’s match.

I’d like to be tall.
I wish __________ tall!

Mark talks about himself all the time.
If only Mark __________ about himself all the time!
answers: would prefer her not to miss

subsectionContent.task: Utwórz nowe zdania używając słów podanych w nawiasach.
content: I would prefer for them to take the exam at a later date. (sooner)
You've left it a long time to start keeping a journal! (high)
He is so quick that it seems like he understands new ideas immediately. (though)
Think about the possibility of getting into Harvard or Yale. It would be so exciting! (suppose)
I'm really sorry I gave her the wrong homework assignment! (only)
It would be better for you to spend more time studying. (rather)
You waited a long time to take your piano playing seriously. (about)
Think about the possibility of winning a lot of money! Would you spend it on your education? (imagine)
answers: I would sooner they took the exam at a later time.
It's high time you started keeping a journal.
He is so quick as though he understands new ideas immediately.
Suppose you got into Harvard or Yale. It would be so exciting.
If only I hadn't given her the wrong homework assignment.
I would rather you spent more time studying.
It's about time you took your piano playing seriously.
Imagine you won a lot of money. Would you spend it on your education?

subsectionContent.task: Przetłumacz fragmenty zdań podane w nawiasach.
content: If only __________ (nie musielibyśmy) deal with troublesome customers!
I’d rather __________ (żebyś przestał) teasing me like that.
If only __________ (umiałbym tańczyć) as gracefully as Bethany.
__________ (Sarah żałuje, że nie zaczęła) taking the traditional medicine earlier.
It’s time __________ (żebyś powiedziała nam prawdę) about the accident.
__________ (Szkoda, że nie przypomniałaś mi) about the parent-teacher meeting.
answers: you told/for you to tell us the truth
I wish you had reminded me

subsectionContent.task: Przetłumacz poniższe zdania.
content: Załuję, że nie mam wystarczająco dużo pieniędzy, żeby zapłacić czesne.
Gdybym tylko nie byłą dla niej taka niemiła.
Żałuję, że mam jutro test. Poszłabym z wami do kina.
Powiedzmy, że musiałbyś jutro przystąpić do egzaminu z matematyki? Zdałbyś go?
A co, gdybyś nie miała dostępu do Internetu przez kilka dni?
Wolelibyśmy, żeby nauczyciele dawali nam mniej pracy domowej.
answers: I wish I had enough money to pay the tuition fees.
If only I hadn't been so unkind to her.
I wish I didn't have a test tomorrow. I'd go to the cinema with you.
Supposing you had to sit a maths exam tomorrow. Would you pass it?
Suppose you had no internet access for a few days?
We'd rather teachers gave us less homework.
